title: Miso Soup & Rice Set
description: A comforting Japanese-style set featuring warm, umami-rich miso soup loaded with silken tofu and wakame, served alongside steamed short-grain rice. Fast to prepare, light, and balanced—perfect for a simple lunch or dinner.

ingredients.notes: rinse until water runs mostly clear; drain before cooking
use slightly more than rice volume for tender steamed rice
wipe surface clean; do not soak excessively
used to make ichiban dashi; strain after steeping
for approximately 2 small bowls of soup
use white (shiromiso) for mild, sweet flavor

ingredients.display_name: silken tofu, drained and cut into 1 cm cubes
ingredients.notes: use soft or silken tofu for smooth texture
rehydrates quickly in broth; measure dry

steps.text: Rinse the short-grain rice under cold water, swirling and draining until the rinse water is mostly clear; drain thoroughly and transfer to a small saucepan with measured water for rice.
Cover the saucepan and bring rice to a gentle simmer over medium heat; once simmering, reduce to the lowest heat and cook covered for 12 minutes without lifting the lid.
While rice is cooking, prepare dashi: place kombu in a separate pot with the dashi water and warm slowly over low heat for 6–7 minutes until small bubbles appear; remove kombu just before boiling.
Add bonito flakes to the hot water off-heat, steep for 1 minute to infuse, then strain through a fine sieve or cheesecloth into the dashi pot, discarding solids.
Return the clear dashi to low heat; add dried wakame and rehydrate for 1–2 minutes until softened.

In a small bowl, dissolve the miso paste with a ladle of hot dashi until smooth (make a miso slurry) then gently stir the slurry back into the pot of dashi off the heat to preserve delicate enzymes and flavor; do not boil after adding miso.
Gently add cubed silken tofu to the miso broth and warm through on very low heat for about 1 minute; adjust seasoning with soy sauce or salt if needed and remove from heat.

Fluff the cooked rice with a rice paddle or fork and let rest covered for 2 minutes to finish steaming; divide rice between bowls and ladle miso soup into separate bowls, garnish with sliced scallions and a tiny drizzle of sesame oil if using.
